snippet: The decision affected 4,300 people whose Jewish ancestors fled the country after being told in 1492 to convert to Catholicism.
abstract: Spain grants dual citizenship to 4,302 people, all descendants of Sephardic Jews who left country in 1492 following edict mandating their conversion to Catholicism.
lead_paragraph: The decision affected 4,300 people whose Jewish ancestors fled the country after being told in 1492 to convert to Catholicism.

headline.main: Spain: Descendants of Exiled Jews Granted Citizenship
